reviews.review_msg: This prof is a nice person but sucks so bad at teaching. Lectures are super long and he goes on tangents often. Class discussions are just him picking one person and asking a super detailed questions that are extremely hard to answer on the spot. He doesn't use canvas except for uploading the slides and syllabus. Terrible, boring course.

Dr. Yellowhorn makes his TA do all the work for his course. He is not accessible via email, despite the course being distance-ed. The workload for the 100-level course is obscene and up to the final paper, I was getting an A+. He gave me a low mark despite performing well for the entirety of the course. He also gives no feedback for his grade..

The workload for this class was beyond what i expected for a 100 level class and took up more time than my 400 level BUS courses. Weekly workbook assignments took forever to finish due to the absurd amount of readings and videos, some of which are over 2 hours. The book review had no grading criteria and left you confused with the grade you got.

Dr. Yellowhorn is fine but he takes forever to grade his papers. I took this course distance-ed so I haven't had any contact with him throughout the course, not sure how much he even creates within it. The TA has marked and made all announcements so far, he is only grading our final paper. It's been almost three weeks and no mark yet.. seriously?

His grading criteria is very arbitrary and gives little guidance as to how he wants things done. Even though he will say there is no criteria, assignments will get handed back with random points taken off for things he never mentioned. He is very interesting and has lots of ideas, but not a good prof. Do not take if you want a good grade.

Eldon is a nice guy. He is very knowledgeable. I really enjoyed how he spread the grades over multiple different types of assignments. He gave clear instructions about the format he wants (which is important to him). Instructions about assignments were vague. The test was hard because he asked super specific and random questions.

Received 0 feedback on assignments throughout the whole course. Midterm included specific details that had no relevance to the course. During discussions he would interrogate students with extremely specific questions about readings that no one ever remembered. Very unclear grading criteria for all assignments. Hard marker.

It's only difficult because he provides no direction, contradicts what he says and does not care if his students succeed. Lectures are just a mess of old slides that jump all over the place with random information that's not necessarily related to the course content. I chose not to listen to the negative reviews and that was a big mistake. Avoid.

The most useless class that I have ever taken. He takes marks off for things that have nothing to do with the assignments. I don't know what to say, I am speechless. Avoid him if possible. You learn nothing from his classes.

My courses were mandatory with Eldon. The second time I had him I was actually PROMISED that he WOULD NOT be teaching the course, but it's a FNST course and he seems to teach all them all the time. Good course if you like stories and interesting facts. Biggest problem is that he grades you on how well you can tell a story and remember random facts.

He knows specific details about random events and expects you as the student to know them as well, regardless of whether or not he asked you to. He says there is 'class discussion' but he really just sits there and picks on one student as asks SUPER specific questions about a detail that really has no relevance to the topic. TERRIBLE

Doesn't explain anything in regards to what he wants for assignments. Even talking to him after class doesn't help. Appears to have a need to let everyone know of any knowledge he has in regards to anything. Nice enough guy but not a very good instructor.

Dr.Y is very approachable and was happy to provide additional feedback/discussion outside of class. He has a wealth of experience in first nations studies/archaeology, so the lectures were interesting. He often expects students to engage in discussions, which lends for a rich learning experience (NOT textbook regurgitation). I recommend his courses

Eldon is a funny guy! I enjoyed this class. He is a fair marker with his assignments, and I liked how he was open on how you interpreted the document you would base it on. He does lack a bit with feedback on your papers which don't really help on doing better for the next assignment, but the grade was not bad. Would recommend this class!

Nice guy,not actually that bad, probably improved from all the bad comments he's gotten. Got rid of the textbook, but has this reading list now filled with articles. His exams though were pure memorization of pretty much word for word from any of the slides. Especially with terrible questions like match the author with their book/article.

exams are based on insignificant facts.  If this were a course on the periodic table, he would quiz you on the atomic mass to 5dp for two elements rather than ask about differences between metals and metalloids.  WASTE OF MONEY AND TIME.  I can't believe this is a requirement for arch students.  Took FNST101 and it was much more informative.

Eldon is very friendly, I highly disagree with the comments on here that attack his character. His expectations are not outside the realm of usual expectations for a 400-level course. The course outline could afford more clarity in regards to word limit, formatting, etc. for assignments but if you ASK he will answer!

the worst prof ever!! lecture class is super boring. Dont even use the textbook.So hard on the exams. Basically u have to memorize individual things based on the notes. If u wannt try to get an  "f" , definitely go for him. All i can say is dont waste ur money and time.

Spent the last half of the semester talking about how bad natives have it...Gave us a slide show in the abosulte darkness So we couldn't take notes. We asked him if it would be on the exam because we couldn't see and he said no. Come exam time low and behold it was the essay question....avoid!
Brutal. He hammers your grade if you don't agree with him on key issues. Zero feedback on papers/assignments and no response to emailed questions.

This was a terrible class. The exams tested your ability to memorize, and not learn concepts. He asks for dates, specific names, and sites. An essay question on the midterm was on a slideshow he gave us with the LIGHTS OFF - how the heck were we supposed to take notes with the lights completely off?! Class averages on tests were low - around 60%.
Where is he during his office hours?  I think his mind is somewhere else.  It never seems as though he is really all there in class.  Lecture is ok, but he kinda generalizes things.
Exam questions are the variety that when studying you think "oh he would never ask that, its totally nitpicky and inconsequential"

He's a good prof, it's just his teaching style is very difficult for students to process. It's true he wants insignificant details when testing so just studying everything and you'll be fine, there isn't that much information. 2 pages typed of notes per lecture.

I was very interested in the class, before it started. He teaches all over the place, favouring native views and opinons. His exams were had ridiculous questions that appeared out of no where (there were even questions about stuff he said wouldn't be on it). The lectures that the TA did where 110x better then his.
Fabulous, intelligent professor
snooze zone

I don't know why everyone is saying his tests are hard. I always aced his exams. Beware the group project/paper in First Nations Issues though. He takes no pity on people who's group members decide they don't need to show up for the presentation.
Hard exams, stupid questions. Almost completely avoided the material that we were supposed to be learning and favoured films/info about Native rights.

Very interesting course material. Ridiculous exams containing irrelevant bits of information. i.e. what is the name of the cook that was mentioned in article x? Very unclear about the goals and lengths of the assignments. He was also condescending at times.  The dept. needs more funding.

Worst class/prof ever. Made boring material worse, and the marking scheme was totally random. Likely exam question: What is the name, birthdate, and driver's license number of the archaeologist who excavated this site? From at student with a 3.8 GPA (would have been higher if not for him).
Worst prof. I ever had. (and I didn't get a bad mark even)

Shockingly misinformed about Indigenous issues e.g. actually thinks tax exemption etc. are contingent rights granted at "the Pleasure of the Crown",rather than based on principles of International Law/sovereignty which states one Nation cannot t
HARD MARKER. ack. study everything!!!!! dont go to class hung over.

He was a super nice person but his exams were ridiculously hard. He had us memorize every minute detail of his lectures and films. No critical thinking in this class. His lectures were a bit dry too, and the textbook didn't correlate to his lectures well.
The most rediculous test questions ever...don't leave class when he shows a film...he'll ask you wasteful questions on the next quiz!  BLECH
Nice guy. Bad teacher. Test questions are rediculous. He is not interested in testing what you learned but how well you memorize.
Awesome!
testes inane trivia that has nothing to do with course material....asked who author of an article was. A lot of material, wants you to memorize all of it.
He seems nice but he's a hard marker. Be prepared to know every bit of trivia for exams
